title: RBC Heritage: Matt Fitzpatrick beats Jordan Spieth in play-off to win tournament
description: England's Matt Fitzpatrick beats American Jordan Spieth in a dramatic play-off to win the RBC Heritage title at Harbour Town in South Carolina.

title: The Papers: Nurses' strike warning and PM's maths promise
description: Warnings that the nurses' strike could continue until Christmas dominate many of Monday's papers.

title: More people could have hidden bowel condition
description: People with microscopic colitis have frequent diarrhoea, stomach pain and fatigue.

title: How artificial intelligence is matching drugs to patients
description: Health-tech firms around the world are increasingly using AI to help tailor drugs for patients.

title: Rishi Sunak sets up review to tackle 'anti-maths mindset'
description: The advisory group will consider whether a new maths qualification is needed for 16 to 18-year-olds.

title: Windrush victims being failed by compensation scheme - report
description: Human Rights Watch says victims of the scandal still face long waits and inadequate compensation.

title: Business confidence up sharply at biggest firms
description: Sentiment is rebounding as concerns about energy prices and Brexit ease.

title: Greener flights will cost more, says industry
description: Demand for air travel will be hit as decarbonisation drives up ticket prices, says industry.

title: 'We wish we could go back': Life in a war-torn Myanmar
description: The BBC visits Myanmar, where two years after the coup, fear and quiet defiance are everywhere.

title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Stones, Fernandes, Enciso, Eze, Haaland
description: Which Premier League players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make the Team of the Week?

title: Antony: Is Manchester United forward starting to live up to £81m price tag?
description: Antony scores once and assists another as Manchester United move up to third in the Premier League - so is he finally starting to prove his worth?

title: West Ham 2-2 Arsenal: Gunners showing signs of self-doubt as they throw away a two-goal lead again
description: After two successive 2-2 draws Arsenal players are showing signs of self-doubt as the Gunners push to become champions for the first time since 2004.

title: Good Friday Agreement: Hillary Clinton urges NI parties to return to power sharing
description: The former US Secretary of State is in Belfast to mark 25 years since the Good Friday Agreement.

title: Scrap all existing smart motorways, says AA
description: It comes after government cancels plans to build more stretches of road without permanent hard shoulders.

title: West Ham 2-2 Arsenal: Hammers show 'strength, character, discipline' to move clear of drop zone
description: West Ham have shown the determination to avoid the Premier League drop, says former defender Matthew Upson.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: France 55-0 Scotland - France blow Scots away in nine-try rout
description: France run in nine unanswered tries to leave Scotland without a point after three rounds of the Women's Six Nations.

title: Amstel Gold Race: Tadej Pogacar & Demi Vollering win maiden titles in Dutch event
description: Tadej Pogacar underlines his status as a dominant force in both stage and one-day races with a superb Amstel Gold Race win, while Demi Vollering wins the women's race.

title: Sudan crisis: Further fierce fighting as clashes spread
description: The escalation came on the second day of conflict between the country's rival armed factions.

title: Nottingham Forest 0-2 Manchester United: Antony scores to send Red Devils up to third
description: Antony scores one and assists another as Manchester United move up to third in the Premier League table with a clinical win over Nottingham Forest

title: Aston Villa 0-1 Chelsea: 'Blues find a way to win to keep Treble hopes on course'
description: Chelsea are used to winning and they are used to competing on several fronts - but it does not mean it is easy as they hunt the Treble.

title: Women's FA Cup: Sam Kerr scores semi-final winner for Chelsea against Aston Villa
description: Holders Chelsea book their place in the Women's FA Cup final as Sam Kerr scores the winning goal to lead her side to a narrow victory over Aston Villa.

title: Leaked video shows Sturgeon dismiss finance concern
description: The former SNP leader tells the party's ruling body in 2021 its finances have never been stronger.

title: Sudan crisis: Shock and anger in Khartoum, a city not used to war
description: Residents say stray bullets and threatened neighbourhood sweeps by armed forces mean nowhere is safe.

title: Ashton reaches 100 Premiership tries as Tigers crush Chiefs
description: Chris Ashton becomes the first player to score 100 Premiership tries as Leicester all but seal a top-four spot.

title: West Ham 2-2 Arsenal: Bukayo Saka misses penalty as Gunners let slip two-goal lead
description: Bukayo Saka misses a penalty as leaders Arsenal draw at West Ham in a blow to their hopes of winning the Premier League.

title: Aston Villa 0-1 Chelsea: Holders reach Women's FA Cup final with narrow win
description: Holders Chelsea book their place in the Women's FA Cup final with a narrow victory over Aston Villa and remain on course to win the trophy for the third year in a row.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023: Neil Robertson sweeps Wu Yize aside in first round
description: Neil Robertson produces a sublime display to defeat Chinese debutant Wu Yize 10-3 in the first round of the World Championship in Sheffield.

title: Women's Six Nations: Pauline Bourdon scores opening try for France against Scotland
description: Watch as "world-class" Pauline Bourdon scores a try for France to open the scoring against Scotland in the Women's Six Nations.

title: Alabama shooting: Four dead at 16th birthday party
description: The shooting happened at a 16th birthday party in the city of Dadeville on Saturday, media reports say.

title: Atiq Ahmed: Moments before former Indian MP shot
description: Dramatic scenes show the moments just before former MP Atiq Ahmed was gunned down in Prayagraj.

title: EU rejects Ukraine grain bans by Poland and Hungary
description: The two countries say the measures are necessary to protect their farming sectors from cheap imports.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023: Stuart Bingham progresses with comfortable win over David Gilbert
description: Stuart Bingham moves into the second round of the World Championship with a comfortable 10-4 win over David Gilbert in Sheffield.

title: Celtic hit four in 20 minutes to thump Kilmarnock
description: Celtic are seven points away from retaining the Scottish Premiership after a first-half goal blitz against relegation threatened Kilmarnock.

title: European Gymnastics Championships 2023: Jessica Gadirova wins third floor title
description: Jessica Gadirova wins her third gold medal at the European Gymnastics Championships with victory in the women's floor final.

title: Grand National: BHA condemns protests & announces analysis of horse deaths
description: The British Horseracing Authority has "robustly condemned" the "reckless" protests at Saturday's Grand National and announces an analysis into the death of three horses at this year's event.

title: Amazon strike: Hundreds of workers in Coventry walk out in pay dispute
description: GMB members walked out at 06:30 BST on Sunday and will strike until Tuesday, the union says.

title: SNP says finances are balanced after crisis reports
description: The party denies reports an exodus of members has left it struggling to balance the books.

title: Nurses' strikes could continue till Christmas, warns RCN union leader
description: Nurses reject a minister's plea to pause a strike, including by staff in emergency care, in two weeks' time.

title: Atiq Ahmed: The brazen murder of an Indian mafia don-turned-politician
description: Atiq Ahmed, shot dead live on TV, built a fiefdom in northern India but his power had begun to wane.

title: Dubai fire: Sixteen killed in blaze at Al-Ras apartment building
description: A statement from Dubai Civil Defence says safety compliance may have been a factor.

title: Atiq Ahmed: Former Indian politician and brother shot dead live on TV
description: Atiq Ahmed, a former politician convicted in a kidnapping case, was shot while under police escort.

title: Bradley Lowery: Jermain Defoe reflects on friendship
description: Six years on from the young Sunderland fan's death, Defoe says he "will always be in my heart".

title: Heavyweight Joe Joyce says his 'journey will continue' after losing to Zhilei Zhang in London
description: British heavyweight Joe Joyce says "the journey will continue" after his defeat by Zhilei Zhang in London on Saturday.

title: Fumio Kishida vows G7 security boost after smoke bomb
description: Fumio Kishida said Japan must "maximise" security for G7 officials after an object was thrown at him.

title: The Papers: Grand National protests and NHS 'mega strike'
description: Many of Sunday's papers focus on the protest by animal rights activists at Aintree.

title: Public emergency message released ahead of UK test
description: An alert will be sent to most smartphones at 15:00 BST on Sunday 23 April as part of a new warning system.

title: Jack Teixeira's hometown of Dighton reacts to his arrest
description: The BBC visits Jack Teixeira's hometown of Dighton, in rural Massachusetts.

title: Keir Starmer: Labour needs to win back Scottish seats
description: Labour's leader says gaining many more Scottish seats would give his party greater legitimacy in power.

title: Yemen war: Women facing daily struggle to survive
description: Many have lost their sons, husbands and brothers - and now face a daily struggle to survive.

title: Why Putin cares about Russia's athletes competing abroad
description: A row is raging over Russians competing in the Olympics and Wimbledon. Why does Russia care so much?
